BackTestAnomalyDetector.name: BackTestAnomalyDetector
BackTestAnomalyDetector.documentation: Runs a backtest for anomaly detection for the specified resource.

CreateAlert.name: CreateAlert
CreateAlert.documentation: Creates an alert for an anomaly detector.

DeleteAnomalyDetector.name: DeleteAnomalyDetector
DeleteAnomalyDetector.documentation: Deletes a detector. Deleting an anomaly detector will delete all of its corresponding resources including any configured datasets and alerts.

DescribeAlert.name: DescribeAlert
DescribeAlert.documentation:
Describes an alert.

Amazon Lookout for Metrics API actions are eventually consistent. If you do a read operation on a resource immediately after creating or modifying it, use retries to allow time for the write operation to complete.

DescribeAnomalyDetectionExecutions.name: DescribeAnomalyDetectionExecutions
DescribeAnomalyDetectionExecutions.documentation: Returns information about the status of the specified anomaly detection jobs.

DescribeAnomalyDetector.name: DescribeAnomalyDetector
DescribeAnomalyDetector.documentation:
Describes a detector.

Amazon Lookout for Metrics API actions are eventually consistent. If you do a read operation on a resource immediately after creating or modifying it, use retries to allow time for the write operation to complete.

DescribeMetricSet.name: DescribeMetricSet
DescribeMetricSet.documentation:
Describes a dataset.

Amazon Lookout for Metrics API actions are eventually consistent. If you do a read operation on a resource immediately after creating or modifying it, use retries to allow time for the write operation to complete.

DetectMetricSetConfig.name: DetectMetricSetConfig
DetectMetricSetConfig.documentation: Detects an Amazon S3 dataset's file format, interval, and offset.

GetAnomalyGroup.name: GetAnomalyGroup
GetAnomalyGroup.documentation: Returns details about a group of anomalous metrics.

GetDataQualityMetrics.name: GetDataQualityMetrics
GetDataQualityMetrics.documentation: Returns details about the requested data quality metrics.

GetSampleData.name: GetSampleData
GetSampleData.documentation: Returns a selection of sample records from an Amazon S3 datasource.

ListAlerts.name: ListAlerts
ListAlerts.documentation:
Lists the alerts attached to a detector.

Amazon Lookout for Metrics API actions are eventually consistent. If you do a read operation on a resource immediately after creating or modifying it, use retries to allow time for the write operation to complete.

ListAnomalyDetectors.name: ListAnomalyDetectors
ListAnomalyDetectors.documentation:
Lists the detectors in the current AWS Region.

Amazon Lookout for Metrics API actions are eventually consistent. If you do a read operation on a resource immediately after creating or modifying it, use retries to allow time for the write operation to complete.

ListAnomalyGroupRelatedMetrics.name: ListAnomalyGroupRelatedMetrics
ListAnomalyGroupRelatedMetrics.documentation: Returns a list of measures that are potential causes or effects of an anomaly group.

ListAnomalyGroupTimeSeries.name: ListAnomalyGroupTimeSeries
ListAnomalyGroupTimeSeries.documentation: Gets a list of anomalous metrics for a measure in an anomaly group.

ListMetricSets.name: ListMetricSets
ListMetricSets.documentation:
Lists the datasets in the current AWS Region.

Amazon Lookout for Metrics API actions are eventually consistent. If you do a read operation on a resource immediately after creating or modifying it, use retries to allow time for the write operation to complete.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Gets a list of tags for a detector, dataset, or alert.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Adds tags to a detector, dataset, or alert.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Removes tags from a detector, dataset, or alert.

UpdateAnomalyDetector.name: UpdateAnomalyDetector
UpdateAnomalyDetector.documentation: Updates a detector. After activation, you can only change a detector's ingestion delay and description.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You do not have sufficient permissions to perform this action.

SNSConfiguration.documentation: A configuration for an Amazon SNS channel.

LambdaConfiguration.documentation: A configuration for an AWS Lambda channel.

Action.documentation: A configuration that specifies the action to perform when anomalies are detected.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The ARN of the anomaly detector.

Action.documentation: Action that will be triggered when there is an alert.

AlertSensitivityThreshold.documentation: The minimum severity for an anomaly to trigger the alert.

LastModificationTime.documentation: The time at which the alert was last modified.

CreationTime.documentation: The time at which the alert was created.

AlertFilters.documentation: The configuration of the alert filters, containing MetricList and DimensionFilter.

MetricList.documentation: The list of measures that you want to get alerts for.

AlertSensitivityThreshold.documentation: The minimum severity for an anomaly to trigger the alert.

LastModificationTime.documentation: The time at which the alert was last modified.

AlertSummary.documentation: Provides a summary of an alert's configuration.

AnomalyDetectorFrequency.documentation: The frequency at which the detector analyzes its source data.
The interval at which the detector analyzes its source data.

StartTimestamp.documentation: The start time for the data quality metrics collection.

MetricSetDataQualityMetricList.documentation: An array of DataQualityMetricList objects. Each object in the array contains information about a data quality metric.

AnomalyDetectorDataQualityMetric.documentation: Aggregated details about the data quality metrics collected for the AnomalyDetectorArn provided in the GetDataQualityMetrics object.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The ARN of the detector.

CreationTime.documentation: The time at which the detector was created.

LastModificationTime.documentation: The time at which the detector was last modified.

AnomalyDetectorSummary.documentation: Contains information about an an anomaly detector.

PrimaryMetricName.documentation: The name of the primary affected measure for the group.

MetricLevelImpactList.documentation: A list of measures affected by the anomaly.

EvaluationStartDate.documentation: The start of the time range that was searched.

ItemizedMetricStatsList.documentation: Statistics for individual metrics within the group.

AnomalyGroupStatistics.documentation: Aggregated statistics for a group of anomalous metrics.

PrimaryMetricName.documentation: The name of the primary affected measure for the group.

AnomalyGroupSummary.documentation: Details about a group of anomalous metrics.

AnomalyGroupTimeSeries.documentation: An anomalous metric in an anomaly group.

IsAnomaly.documentation: Feedback on whether the metric is a legitimate anomaly.

RoleArn.documentation: An IAM role that gives Amazon Lookout for Metrics permission to access the flow.

AppFlowConfig.documentation: Details about an Amazon AppFlow flow datasource.

RoleArn.documentation: An IAM role that gives Amazon Lookout for Metrics permission to access the data.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector.

RunBackTestMode.documentation: Run a backtest instead of monitoring new data.

RoleArn.documentation: An IAM role that gives Amazon Lookout for Metrics permission to access data in Amazon CloudWatch.

ConflictException.documentation: There was a conflict processing the request. Try your request again.

ContributionMatrix.documentation: Details about dimensions that contributed to an anomaly.

AlertSensitivityThreshold.documentation: An integer from 0 to 100 specifying the alert sensitivity threshold.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The ARN of the detector to which the alert is attached.

Action.documentation: Action that will be triggered when there is an alert.

Tags.documentation: A list of tags to apply to the alert.

AlertFilters.documentation: The configuration of the alert filters, containing MetricList and DimensionFilterList.

Tags.documentation: A list of tags to apply to the anomaly detector.

The ARN of the anomaly detector that will use the dataset.

MetricSetDescription.documentation: A description of the dataset you are creating.

MetricList.documentation: A list of metrics that the dataset will contain.

Offset.documentation: After an interval ends, the amount of seconds that the detector waits before importing data. Offset is only supported for S3, Redshift, Athena and datasources.

TimestampColumn.documentation: Contains information about the column used for tracking time in your source data.

DimensionList.documentation: A list of the fields you want to treat as dimensions.

MetricSetFrequency.documentation: The frequency with which the source data will be analyzed for anomalies.

MetricSource.documentation: Contains information about how the source data should be interpreted.

Timezone.documentation: The time zone in which your source data was recorded.

Tags.documentation: A list of tags to apply to the dataset.

DimensionFilterList.documentation: A list of filters that specify which data is kept for anomaly detection.

FileCompression.documentation: The level of compression of the source CSV file.

Charset.documentation: The character set in which the source CSV file is written.

ContainsHeader.documentation: Whether or not the source CSV file contains a header.

Delimiter.documentation: The character used to delimit the source CSV file.

HeaderList.documentation: A list of the source CSV file's headers, if any.

QuoteSymbol.documentation: The character used as a quote character.

CsvFormatDescriptor.documentation: Contains information about how a source CSV data file should be analyzed.

MetricType.documentation: The name of the data quality metric.

MetricDescription.documentation: A description of the data quality metric.

MetricValue.documentation: The value of the data quality metric.

DataQualityMetric.documentation: An array that describes a data quality metric. Each DataQualityMetric object contains the data quality metric name, its value, a description of the metric, and the affected column.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector.

AlertArn.documentation: The ARN of the alert to delete.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The ARN of the detector to delete.

AlertArn.documentation: The ARN of the alert to describe.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector.

Timestamp.documentation: The timestamp of the anomaly detection job.

MaxResults.documentation: The number of items to return in the response.

NextToken.documentation: Specify the pagination token that's returned by a previous request to retrieve the next page of results.
The pagination token that's included if more results are available.

FailureType.documentation: The process that caused the detector to fail.

CreationTime.documentation: The time at which the dataset was created.

LastModificationTime.documentation: The time at which the dataset was last modified.

Offset.documentation: After an interval ends, the amount of seconds that the detector waits before importing data. Offset is only supported for S3, Redshift, Athena and datasources.

MetricList.documentation: A list of the metrics defined by the dataset.

TimestampColumn.documentation: Contains information about the column used for tracking time in your source data.

DimensionList.documentation: A list of the dimensions chosen for analysis.

MetricSetFrequency.documentation: The interval at which the data will be analyzed for anomalies.

Timezone.documentation: The time zone in which the dataset's data was recorded.

MetricSource.documentation: Contains information about the dataset's source data.

DimensionFilterList.documentation: The dimensions and their values that were used to filter the dataset.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: An anomaly detector ARN.

DetectedMetricSetConfig.documentation: The inferred dataset configuration for the datasource.

DimensionValueContributionList.documentation: A list of dimension values that contributed to the anomaly.

DimensionContribution.documentation: Details about a dimension that contributed to an anomaly.

DimensionName.documentation: The name of the dimension to filter on.

DimensionValueList.documentation: The list of values for the dimension specified in DimensionName that you want to filter on.

DimensionFilter.documentation: The dimension filter, containing DimensionName and DimensionValueList.

DimensionValueContribution.documentation: The severity of a value of a dimension that contributed to an anomaly.

FailureReason.documentation: The reason that the run failed, if applicable.

ExecutionStatus.documentation: The status of an anomaly detector run.

CsvFormatDescriptor.documentation: Contains information about how a source CSV data file should be analyzed.

JsonFormatDescriptor.documentation: Contains information about how a source JSON data file should be analyzed.

FileFormatDescriptor.documentation: Contains information about a source file's formatting.

DimensionValue.documentation: The value that you want to include in the filter.

Filter.documentation: Describes a filter for choosing a subset of dimension values. Each filter consists of the dimension that you want to include and the condition statement. The condition statement is specified in the FilterOperation object.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector that you want to investigate.

MetricSetArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a specific data quality metric set.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return.

The pagination token that's included if more results are available.

HeaderValues.documentation: A list of header labels for the records.

RelationshipType.documentation: Whether a measure is a potential cause of the anomaly group (CAUSE_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP), or whether the measure is impacted by the anomaly group (EFFECT_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP).

ContributionPercentage.documentation: For potential causes (CAUSE_OF_INPUT_ANOMALY_GROUP), the percentage contribution the measure has in causing the anomalies.

InterMetricImpactDetails.documentation: Aggregated details about the measures contributing to the anomaly group, and the measures potentially impacted by the anomaly group.

InternalServerException.documentation: The request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception, or failure.

OccurrenceCount.documentation: The number of times that the measure appears.

ItemizedMetricStats.documentation: Aggregated statistics about a measure affected by an anomaly.

FileCompression.documentation: The level of compression of the source CSV file.

Charset.documentation: The character set in which the source JSON file is written.

JsonFormatDescriptor.documentation: Contains information about how a source JSON data file should be analyzed.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of an IAM role that has permission to invoke the Lambda function.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The ARN of the alert's detector.

MetricSetSummaryList.documentation: A list of the datasets in the AWS Region, with configuration details for each.

NextToken.documentation: If the response is truncated, the list call returns this token. To retrieve the next set of results, use the token in the next list request.

AggregationFunction.documentation: The function with which the metric is calculated.

Metric.documentation: A calculation made by contrasting a measure and a dimension from your source data.

NumTimeSeries.documentation: The number of anomalous metrics for the measure.

ContributionMatrix.documentation: Details about the dimensions that contributed to the anomaly.

MetricLevelImpact.documentation: Details about a measure affected by an anomaly.

MetricSetArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the data quality metric array.

DataQualityMetricList.documentation: The array of data quality metrics contained in the data quality metric set.

MetricSetDataQualityMetric.documentation: An array of DataQualityMetric objects that describes one or more data quality metrics.

Name.documentation: The dimension that you want to filter on.

FilterList.documentation: The list of filters that you are applying.

MetricSetDimensionFilter.documentation: Describes a list of filters for choosing a subset of dimension values. Each filter consists of the dimension and one of its values that you want to include. When multiple dimensions or values are specified, the dimensions are joined with an AND operation and the values are joined with an OR operation.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The ARN of the detector to which the dataset belongs.

CreationTime.documentation: The time at which the dataset was created.

LastModificationTime.documentation: The time at which the dataset was last modified.

CloudWatchConfig.documentation: Details about an Amazon CloudWatch monitoring datasource.

RDSSourceConfig.documentation: Details about an Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) datasource.

RedshiftSourceConfig.documentation: Details about an Amazon Redshift database datasource.

MetricSource.documentation: Contains information about source data used to generate metrics.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the anomaly detector.

DatabasePort.documentation: The port number where the database can be accessed.

SecretManagerArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Secrets Manager role.

TableName.documentation: The name of the table in the database.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role.

VpcConfiguration.documentation: An object containing information about the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) configuration.

RDSSourceConfig.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) configuration.

DatabasePort.documentation: The port number where the database can be accessed.

SecretManagerArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Secrets Manager role.

TableName.documentation: The table name of the Redshift database.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role providing access to the database.

VpcConfiguration.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) configuration.

RedshiftSourceConfig.documentation: Provides information about the Amazon Redshift database configuration.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The specified resource cannot be found. Check the ARN of the resource and try again.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of an IAM role that has read and write access permissions to the source S3 bucket.

TemplatedPathList.documentation: A list of templated paths to the source files.

HistoricalDataPathList.documentation: A list of paths to the historical data files.

FileFormatDescriptor.documentation: Contains information about a source file's formatting.

S3SourceConfig.documentation: Contains information about the configuration of the S3 bucket that contains source files.

RoleArn.documentation: The ARN of the IAM role that has access to the target SNS topic.

SnsTopicArn.documentation: The ARN of the target SNS topic.

SnsFormat.documentation:
The format of the SNS topic.

  • JSON – Send JSON alerts with an anomaly ID and a link to the anomaly detail page. This is the default.

  • LONG_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with information about the impacted timeseries and a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for email.

  • SHORT_TEXT – Send human-readable alerts with a link to the anomaly detail page. We recommend this for SMS.

SNSConfiguration.documentation: Contains information about the SNS topic to which you want to send your alerts and the IAM role that has access to that topic.

RoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role.

TemplatedPathList.documentation: An array of strings containing the list of templated paths.

HistoricalDataPathList.documentation: An array of strings containing the historical set of data paths.

SampleDataS3SourceConfig.documentation: Contains information about the source configuration in Amazon S3.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: The request exceeded the service's quotas. Check the service quotas and try again.

Tags.documentation: Tags to apply to the resource. Tag keys and values can contain letters, numbers, spaces, and the following symbols: _.:/=+@-

TimeSeries.documentation: Details about a metric. A metric is an aggregation of the values of a measure for a dimension value, such as availability in the us-east-1 Region.

IsAnomaly.documentation: Feedback on whether the metric is a legitimate anomaly.

TimeSeriesFeedback.documentation: Details about feedback submitted for an anomalous metric.

TimestampColumn.documentation: Contains information about the column used to track time in a source data file.

TooManyRequestsException.documentation: The request was denied due to too many requests being submitted at the same time.

TagKeys.documentation: Keys to remove from the resource's tags.

AlertArn.documentation: The ARN of the alert to update.

AlertSensitivityThreshold.documentation: An integer from 0 to 100 specifying the alert sensitivity threshold.

Action.documentation: Action that will be triggered when there is an alert.

AlertFilters.documentation: The configuration of the alert filters, containing MetricList and DimensionFilterList.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The ARN of the detector to update.

KmsKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS KMS encryption key.

AnomalyDetectorConfig.documentation: Contains information about the configuration to which the detector will be updated.

AnomalyDetectorArn.documentation: The ARN of the updated detector.

MetricSetArn.documentation: The ARN of the dataset to update.

Offset.documentation: After an interval ends, the amount of seconds that the detector waits before importing data. Offset is only supported for S3, Redshift, Athena and datasources.

DimensionFilterList.documentation: Describes a list of filters for choosing specific dimensions and specific values. Each filter consists of the dimension and one of its values that you want to include. When multiple dimensions or values are specified, the dimensions are joined with an AND operation and the values are joined with an OR operation.

ValidationException.documentation: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by the AWS service. Check your input values and try again.

Message.documentation: The message with more information about the validation exception.

ValidationExceptionField.documentation: Contains information about a a field in a validation exception.

SubnetIdList.documentation: An array of strings containing the Amazon VPC subnet IDs (e.g., subnet-0bb1c79de3EXAMPLE.

SecurityGroupIdList.documentation: An array of strings containing the list of security groups.

VpcConfiguration.documentation: Contains configuration information about the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

documentation: This is the Amazon Lookout for Metrics API Reference. For an introduction to the service with tutorials for getting started, visit Amazon Lookout for Metrics Developer Guide.
